thread.title: Former CIA leaders release book defending brutal tactics
thread.title_full: Former CIA leaders release book defending brutal tactics | News24

author: news24.com
title: Former CIA leaders release book defending brutal tactics
text:
Washington - Former senior CIA officials instrumental in extracting information from al-Qaeda prisoners through what most Americans consider to have been torture have published a book defending their conduct.
The book, titled Rebuttal , takes aim at the Senate intelligence committee report released last year that revealed gruesome details of the once-secret CIA programme while portraying it as ineffective, incompetently run, and rife with misrepresentations.
Published by the US Naval Institute, the volume features essays from three former CIA directors and other retired senior officials. They argue that the Senate report, written by Democratic staff and opposed by Republicans, significantly distorted reality.
The staff of Senator Dianne Feinstein, the intelligence committee chairperson, says the book has numerous inaccuracies. The result is a thick stew of charges and counter charges that have been characteristic of the torture debate.
